name: places/ChIJlVY-svBYwokR-y5lFLJqBDw
formattedAddress: 10 E 53rd St, New York, NY 10022, USA
adrFormatAddress: 10 E 53rd St, New York, NY 10022, USA

originalText.text:
I think Dr. Melinger may be among the best in his field. He is competent, attentive, meticulous, and administers the local anesthetic like no other. This means a root canal is a painless and pleasant experience with effective and enduring local anesthesia.

My experience with Dr Melinger was not limited to my root canal 2 years ago. He also made a diagnosis that no one else could make for 4 years. (Pro tip- don't have your general dentist perform root canals.) Today I had successful oral surgery with him. Despite the complexity of the procedure, it was painless.

He office is relaxing and clean and it is nice to see the sky while he works.

originalText.text: Dr. Melinger's local anesthetic skill and technique are amazing. He provides care with advanced technology in a therapeutic environment. He has a disarming and calming patient care manor. Should you need endodontic treatment, I strongly recommend his care!

text.text: Dr. Melinger's local anesthetic skill and technique are amazing. He provides care with advanced technology in a therapeutic environment. He has a disarming and calming patient care manor. Should you need endodontic treatment, I strongly recommend his care!

originalText.text: Dr. Jeffrey Sas is highly skilled and very professional unlike most other dental offices i've been to. He save my tooth when other Dentist just wanted to pull it out. When the reckless Dental office I visited informed me she wanted to pull my tooth instead of cleaning the root canal. I did my research and found out about Endodontist. Apparently, these NY Dentist are not skilled to do a root canal. You need an Endodontist. Dr. Sas performed surgery on the tooth with relaxing classical music playing in the background. He ensured along the way I was okay. I give 10 starsðŸ¤©ðŸ¤©!!!! My visit was in July 2020. Dr. Sas pinpointed exactly where the pain was coming from. Apparently, I have two teeth needing root canal. One above and one at the bottom. When I went to the reckless dentist she   told the wrong tooth at the bottom was the cause of the pain and immediately said it can't be save. We need to pull it. Dr. Sas identified the correct tooth. I have had no pain since then.

originalText.text: Totally painless and easy root canal.  Highly skilled.  I'd recommend him to anyone
